slides.ArrowStyle.name: ArrowStyle
slides.ArrowStyle.doc: The kinds of start and end forms with which linear geometry can be rendered.

property.doc: An arrow style that is not supported.

property.name: NONE
property.doc: No arrow.

property.doc: Arrow with notched back. Corresponds to ECMA-376 ST_LineEndType value 'stealth'.

property.name: FILL_ARROW
property.doc: Filled arrow. Corresponds to ECMA-376 ST_LineEndType value 'triangle'.

property.name: UNSUPPORTED
property.doc: An auto text type that is not supported.

property.name: SLIDE_NUMBER
property.doc: A slide number.

property.name: NORMAL
property.doc: The cell is not merged.

property.name: HEAD
property.doc: The cell is merged and it is the head (i.e. upper left) cell within the merged set of cells. As an example, assume the following table. ------------------- |(0,0)|(0,1)|(0,2)| ------------------- If the first two cells are merged to form the following table, cell (0,0) is the head cell and (0,1) is a merged cell. ------------------- |(0,0) |(0,2)| -------------------

property.name: MERGED
property.doc: The cell is merged but is not the head (i.e. upper left) cell. As an example, assume the following table. ------------------- |(0,0)|(0,1)|(0,2)| ------------------- If the first two cells are merged to form the following table, cell (0,0) is the head cell and (0,1) is a merged cell. ------------------- |(0,0) |(0,2)| -------------------

property.doc: Aligns the content to the top of the content holder. Corresponds to ECMA-376 ST_TextAnchoringType 't'.
